channel.title: Posts on COMP3331 Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on COMP3331 Musings

item.title: Client-Server Architecture
item.description: In the client-server network architecture, the network communication is modelled as clients accessing the same server to handle all of their requests.

item.title: Peer-to-Peer Architecture
item.description: In contrast to the client-server architecture, everyone’s machine operates as both a client and a server.

item.title: Video Delivery
item.description: Video Issue: Heterogeneity - different capabilities of devices (bandwidth, performance)

item.title: DNS
item.description: DNS Computers are identified by IP addresses, but they are not human-friendly, and are hard to remember.

item.title: Page Speeds
item.description: Page Speeds The Page Load Time (PLT) is the time it takes for the page to load.

item.title: States
item.description: Stateful and Stateless Protocols TCP is stateful, meaning that each request has some sort of knowledge of prior interaction HTTP is stateless, meaning that each request is unaware of each other

item.title: TCP/IP Stack - Application Layer
item.description: Application Layer Creating a network app As discussed earlier, as layers are independent, we need to write programs which:

item.title: TCP/IP Stack - Transport Layer
item.description: Transport Layer TCP Protocol reliable transport flow control congestion control (slows down the sender then network is busy) Does not provide timing, minimum throughput guarantee or security connection oriented (setup is required between client and server) UDP Protocol unreliable data transfer does not provide flow control, congestion control, timing, throughput guarantee security or connection setup

item.title: The TCP/IP Stack
item.description: Internet Protocol Stack Application - (FTP, HTTP, Skype…) Transport - (TCP, UDP) Network - (IP, routing protocols) Link - (Ethernet, 802.

item.title: The Network Toolkit
item.description: The Toolkit netstat - Print network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections, and multi‚Äêcast memberships netperf - a network performance benchmark dig - DNS lookup utility host - another DNS lookup utility nslookup - yet another DNS lookup utility ping - send ICMP ECHO_REQUEST to network hosts traceroute - print the route packets trace to network host tracepath - trace route tool mtr - trace route tool wireshark - Interactively dump and analyze network traffic

item.title: Circuit and Packet Switching
item.description: Finding the destination - Switching In the old times, some people worked as telephone operators - where they physically “switched” network connections on a giant switchboard to connect a caller to the receiver’s network.

item.title: Internet Connection Mediums
item.description: Internet Connection Mediums (Asymmetric / Symmetric) Digital Subscriber Line DSL and ADSL internet connections operate over the copper telephone line that you might find in your house.

item.title: Introduction to Networks
item.description: Yada-yada The internet is interconnection of a group of separate networks.
